metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6764 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The BasicJsonStringifier::SerializeJSArray function in json-stringifier.h in the JSON stringifier in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 47.0.2526.73, improperly loads array elements, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.1
nodejs-legacy - 4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nodejs package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.1').
